children.text: A psalm written by David
Mighty people, praise Yahweh!
Praise him because he is very glorious and powerful.
Praise Yahweh with the glory his names deserves.
Bow down and worship Yahweh because he is holy and his holiness shines out from him with wonderful beauty.
Yahweh's voice is heard above the oceans;
the glorious God thunders.
He appears over the huge oceans.
His voice is powerful and majestic.
Yahweh's voice breaks great cedar trees,
the cedars that grow in Lebanon.
He causes earthquakes to shake the region of Lebanon as a young cow jumps;
he causes Sirion (also called Mount Hermon) to shake as a young bull jumps.
Yahweh's voice tells the lightning to flash.
His voice causes the desert to shake;
he shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.
Yahweh's voice makes the large trees shake,
and strips the leaves from the trees
while the people in the temple shout, "Praise God!"
Yahweh rules over the flood that covered the earth;
he is our king who will rule forever.
Yahweh enables his people to be strong,
and he blesses them by causing things to go well for them.
